tagDescription: Introducing Count Joseph Merlive and Doctor Scandella - two Italian gentlemen.
Enclosed: (2) 31 July, 1800.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1808
tagDescription: Accounts.
President desires copy of his address to the Executive Council.
Delay in public business.
Complaint against hogs.
Complaints.
Order for 200 copies of the proclamation establishing a public market in York.
Reports that a measure adopted the previous year to enforce the taking of the oath of allegiance is unpopular and ineffective. Transmits the draft of a bill to enforce enrolments in the militia.
Wm. Jarvis, relative to the distressing condition of his father-in-law due to Curgenvins' unjust embarrassment of him.
Recommends Wm. Burn, his agent and overseer who has been directed to examine the townships along the Thames and Lake Erie, west of Long Point.
Extract of a letter on the appointment of Capt. McGill as agent for the purchase of provisions.
Return of Loyalists stores in charge of Wm. Ross, deputy commissary, Kingston.
Survey of Third Township.
Administrator to the Secretary of the Province.
Enclosed: List of families moving from New Brunswick to Upper Canada.
Order for the printing of certain proclamation and notices.
Petition of Robert Randall for a revision of the report of the Council on his petition for the erection of Iron Works at Niagara.
Encloses a copy of a printed advertisement respecting Crown and Clergy reserves in Upper Canada, 16 October, for insertion in the Gazette.

Concerning a proposal to raise a fund from the disposal of waste lands. Comments on the confusion that has existed since 1792, concerning the disposal of such lands. Further comment on the new system.
Copy of dedimus potestatem appointing commissioners for administering the oath of allegiance to persons in the Niagara district.
Complains of certain people belonging to the Militia who refuse to take the oath of allegiance.
Order for 50 copies of a Proclamation appointing Friday, March 16, as a fast throughout the province, and for 100 copies of the prayer for use on that occasion.
John Cosens Ogden: wishes situation as Clergyman.
Th. Aston Coffin. Public accounts.
Report on the number of acres of land remaining unlocated in Townships of Harwich, Howard, and Yarmouth.
Encloses Joseph Bouchette's list of Upper Canada plans.

Enclosed: Copy of Royal Regulations in respect to carrying on fortifications or other military services by any of our commanders-in-chief, governors, Lt.-governors, or other officers, civil or military, commanding in any part of our dominions.
Transmits a copy of his letter to Col. McDonell on the subject of false charges brought against him by Mr. Dame.

Schedule of Patents in the secretary's office under an Order of Council of June 5, 1800, establishing a new form of grant prepared by the judges, which form was found afterwards not to embrace the reservations under the Regulations of 9 July, 1796.
Reporting that all the lands in Gainsborough and Clinton are made out according to the original surveyor. No other is known.
On behalf of 3 Mohawk chiefs - John, Isaac, and Aron, who seek land.
Advocating that the Inspector General inspect descriptions for patents for land previous to their being engrossed into patents. Gives reasons.
Davenport Phelps to the acting surveyor general. Concerning Francis Heartwell, alias Francis Blood, who was granted land, but turns out to be a former convict.
Memorandum from D. W. Smith, surveyor general, stating the different authorities for granting lands.

Extract of orders for incurring an expense in transport of grants to privileged persons. York, 4 August, 1801; and for a charge of 15s. for furnishing the printer with a copy of preliminaries articles of peace, 11 February, 1802.
Applies for the late Jacob Farrand's positions for his nephew.

tagNotebook: UPPER CANADA SUNDRIES January to June 1809
tagDescription: Requests number and description of lot occupied by Bates' tavern.
Authority for payment of the salary of the garrison clerk at Amherstburg.
Explanation from David Wm. Smith, acting surveyor general on the matter of searches in the surveyor general's office and fees required for the same.
Recommending Andrew Rochead and Alexander Cameron as settlers.
Certificate of service for Thos. Harris.
Transmits his report of the trial of Zineas Nash and Benjamin Ward for robbery of the King's Dock Yard at Kingston.
Copy of the Report of the Committee of the whole Council on the subject of fees to be allowed on the leases of Crown and Clergy reserves.
J.H. Allcock, chief justice, on the subject of the suppose murder of James King.
Provisions.

Transmits his memorial for an increase of salary as overseer of the locks at the Cascades. Transmits also a copy of the letter from Jas. W. Gordon (on behalf of the Duke of Kent) to Bordwine, relative to his memorial.
Messrs. Chewett and Ridout. Memorandum respecting a plot of unsurveyed land, in the rear of Mr. De Longueuil's Seigneury Eastern district.
Memorial of Angus McDonell relative to the construction of a bridge over the River Don near York.
Schedule of Acts passed in 2nd Session of the 1st Legislature of Upper Canada
Returns a paper containing his remarks on land for the French emigrants. [Paper not at this place].
Reporting that the Chief Justice wishes John Small to forward the report of claims to land passed in the District of Johnstown for his signature.
Purchases of peas and flour for the troops and method of conducting the same through the agent.

Summary of the rise, progress, and actual state of the Loyalists colony in Upper Canada. [In Mr. Justice Powell's handwriting]. Note at the bottom indicates that this was enclosed with a letter from Powell of 27 May, 1801, but the covering letter is not at this place.
Land.
On behalf of Wm. Newberry, convicted of highway robbery.
Observation of the Commanding engineer on communications on West side of river between Lake Ontario and Lake Erie.
State of the King's Rights and revenues at Detroit.
Asking Cockrill to come to see him that evening.
Concerning certain projects of his for the improvement of the province Milling of wheat at Niagara and transportation to Lower Canada.
Directions to make out a schedule of particular days and times on which rent becomes due on leases of Crown and Clergy reserves.
Affidavit of Hazleton Spencer concerning his right to half-pay.
Opinion of the attorney general on the Order in Council of June 11, 1799.
Respecting lands reserved by the Crown for military purposes.
Respecting the mode of granting waste lands of the Crown.
Copy of a letter On the subject of locations in the old townships of the Midland district or district of Niagara.
His Majesty's confirmation of the Marriage Act.
Stating his reasons for recommending Lieut. Philip of the Lennox Militia.
Regulations concerning recommendations for leases of land.
Petition of Wm. and Joseph Fortune of Prescott relative to land in Hawkesbury.
J. Macaulay, asking permission for the bearer to lodge powder in the magazine for Bell and Stewart.
Is en route to the States and hopes to see Allen in Albany.
Directions to survey and lay out the Township of Finch in the Eastern district for Allan and John McMillan, and the Scotch emigrants who arrive last September.
attorney general. Respecting the quantity of land allowed to be granted under the King's instructions with the payment of fees thereon.
Extract of a letter respecting the fees to be taken on grants of land.
Reporting that Lord Dorchester has sailed for England. Transmits Regulations of Trade between Canada and U. S. [Regulations not at this place.]
Copy of the previous document.
Enclosed: Extract of a letter to Brigade Major Littlehales, Montreal, 27 January, 1796.
Schedule of Acts passed in 4th Session of the 2nd Parliament of Upper Canada.
Silvester Tiffany on behalf of Gideon Tiffany. Bill of rates.
Respecting Mr. Talbot's services and claims to the protection of H.M. Goot.
Enclosed: Copy of Father Edmund Burke's letter to Col. McDonell, Kingston, 22 May, 1801.
Order to pay Messrs. David and Michaels £63
Jas. Green. Stating that only British soldiers discharged in Canada at the peace of 1783 are entitled to receive land as military claimants. German troops must pay the fees.
Notes on Mr. Playter's petition.
Directions to survey and lay out the rest of the Township of Gwillinsburgh in the Home district and Elmsley in Johnstown district.
Transmitting his letter from Lord Hobart. Asks for lands in Upper Canada. [Letter not at this place.]
Granting the memorial of Thos. Clarke to erect wharves and storehouses a Queenston, Chippawa Creek, and Fort Erie.
Reports the arrival of Capt. Charlton with the detachment of the 5th. Regt. from Michiliamackinac. Has sent Capt.. Bygrave with 3 companies of the 26th Reg't. aboard the MISSISSAUGA.
Certificate of marriage for Albert Haines and Catharine Folluck.
Reporting on the nuisance of Sheek's Mill which obstructs navigation. Also on the justices who refused to qualify in consequence of Mr. Weager's appointment as magistrate.
Points out the necessity of keeping separate accounts of the rents arising from Crown and Clergy reserves.
Land granting in America. Indian lands.
Circular letters to the Magistrates and Clerks of the Peace respecting the United Empire Loyalists.

Legislature to meet June 2. Sentence of death against Humphrey Sullivan for forgery, to be carried into execution. Has written to Portland for advice on filling the position of attorney general, vacated by death of Mr. White.
Forbidding a charge for warrants issued to Loyalists.
Schedule of the Acts of the 2nd Session of the 1st Legislature of Upper Canada.
Observations respecting Danforth's road.
Note on the laying out of a tom.
John Collins. Schemes for a town and public buildings.
[Enclosed in James Green to John McGill, 8 August, 1802.]
Enclosed: (1) Copy of Lord Hobart's circular letter, 1 May 1802.
Asking for authority from the Lt. Governor to pay Mr. Stegman his account when the survey of Markham is completed.
Same to the same. All persons not having the mark of exemption of U.E. or M.C., must in future pay survey money regardless of the date of the Order in Council.
Enclosed: (1) Memorial of Charles Bordwine, Cascades, 30 September, 1800.
Resigns his situation as clerk of the peace.
Respecting the conduct of Mr. Beasley at the last election. Beasley had encouraged the people to vote for no one who held an office under government.
Encloses a list of the names of four families moving from New Brunswick to Upper Canada. Recommends them to His Excellency.
D. W. Smith, transmitting a Report for approval and signature. [Report not at this place.]
Reporting the escape of Jack York, under sentence of death in the Western District.
Directing them to transmit an annual report of fines, amercements, and forfeitures to the Court of King's Bench.
Report on 39 minutes of search upon the Newcastle commission of June, 1803.
Directions to survey and lay out the rest of the Townships of Dover and Chatham in the Western district.
Transmits a letter of the same date, the contents to be communicated to Hunter at Major Green's discretion. Two years salary are due to him as adjutant general of militia.
United Empire Loyalists Roll, District of Niagara.
Enclosed: Schedule of lots unlocated in Harwich, Howard, and Yarmouth.
Enclosed: 2 May, 1800

Asks for more copies of the Acts of the Legislature. The reduction of the Marine force on the Lakes prevents placing the CATHERINE and SOPHIA gun-boats under Russell's command. Has issued a warrant for £2500 stg. toward defraying the civil expenses of Upper Canada.
Certificate for work done for the Government by John Bennett, government printer.
Order to draw upon Mr. Goddard, late agent for the province, for sums necessary for the erection of churches.
Directions to engross a schedule of the Acts of the 3rd Session of the present Parliament. Also to furnish the printer with a copy of the Acts entitled An Act for the Sale of Land and by the Sheriff.
Enclosed: Copy of a list of Upper Canada plans by Joseph Bouchette.
Copy of a list of Upper Canada plans. [Enclosed in D. W. Smith, surveyor general, to Major Green, 17 May, 1802].
General statement of accounts returned to the Inspector General's office. Lands transferred to Robt. J. D. Gray under Order in Council of June 29, 1799
Relative to terms on which leases of Crown and clergy reserves are granted; expresses doubts as to the advisability of issuing fiats for grants of land upon very old authority.
On the subject of Schanck's intended retirement from active service.
Proposal for setting apart a township in each district to settle the children of the U.E.L., with an estimate for carrying the same into execution.
Directing him to transmit a return of all leases that have been perfected for Crown and clergy reserves.

Encloses a copy of Lord Hobart's circular letter to him of 1 May, 1802, a copy of H.M. Proclamation on the conclusion of the war, and an abstract of regulations for the navigation of British ships in time of peace, 5 April, 1802.
On J. McGill's appointment as agent for purchasing provisions; his salary, etc.
Indenture between Hon. Peter Russell on the one part, and Joseph Allen and Joseph Forsyth of Kingston on the other.
Asks for printed copies of the Acts of the Province of Lower Canada.
Requests leave of absence for Mr. Selby, assistant secretary.

Proceedings of a Board of Survey held at York on 7 October, 1799. To examine into the state and condition of stores sent from England for the use of the Loyalists (or Civil Government of Upper Canada).
Asks for 2 yoke of oxen and 2 cows. Hopes to see Cockrill in York.
Enclosed: Advertisement respecting Crown and Clergy reserves. 16 October 1802. [Printed.]
Order for 150 copies of a Proclamation enforcing the Act for allowing time for the sale of lands by the sheriff.
Enclosed: (2) Official protest against appropriation of lands and erection of buildings for the use of merchants, without permission, 30 November, 1796.
Extract of letter from Col. James Gray. Road from Baudet River to Long Sault. Related papers.
Thos. Colpitts. Mails.
Relative to the transmission of his opinion on the validity of the appointment of sheriffs.
Asking if there is any authority in the Council Office for granting lands to certain persons. Small's answer is copied in the same
Certificate of Caleb Reynolds for half-pay.
Proceedings of a Board of Survey on Government stores sent out for the Loyalists in 1792.
Enclosed: Form of the return to be made by Mr. Jarvis for Crown and clergy leases.
Extract of a letter from Lord Hobart concerning the grant of land to the family of General Arnold.

Transmits an extract from H.M.'s Instructions to the master general of the ordnance, dated 7 September, 1791, and for the minute of the Treasury on which are founded his objections to establishing York as a military post, without express orders from H.M. Minister.
Warrant for £2500 on account of the Civil Expenditure of the Government of Upper Canada.
Schedule of Acts passed in 3rd Session of the 1st Parliament of Upper Canada.
Enclosed: Report of the trial of Zineas Nash and Benjamin Ward for robbing the King's Yard at Kingston.
Schedule of Acts passed in 3rd Session of the 3rd Provincial Parliament of Upper Canada.
Copy of the above return of public stores.
Council to be summoned at Colonel Shaw's earliest convenience.
Proclamation suspending ordinances which obstruct commerce with the United States.
Returns thanks for his appointment to the Bench of the Western District Court.
Report on a Bill prepared by the attorney general for removing certain legal difficulties.
Respecting certain recognizances, wherein he trusted too much to the schedule given by Mr. Russell. Sundry other matters referred to vaguely.
Authority given by Caleb Reynolds to pay Mrs. Elizabeth Thompson £15 16.2d. stg.
Will transmit the sum of ?2 7s. with his estreat.
Reports the destruction by fire of the ammunition for the County of Dundas.

Sends a copy of the Patent for dividing the Upper part of the Province of Quebec into districts. - [Not here enclosed] - Detachment sent to St. Joseph's, under Capt. Drummond, will be sufficient to secure that Post from insult. Intends to send reinforcements to Upper Canada next spring.
Regarding land for Mr. White's widow and children.
Regarding the Memorial and papers on the North West Company and their desire for a grant of land. Simcoe explains his views and recommends the petition.
Appointment of Henry Hamilton as Lieutenant Governor and Superintendant of the Post previously called the Detroit.
Joseph Pomroy accuses W. Hedge of being an enemy of the United States.
Sale of mills to Tiffany and Brigham.
Returns the plan of the 13 acre clearing for Government House. [Plan not at this place.]
Enclosed: Extract from the Judges' note book, 12 September, 1800 on the same case.
Memorandum concerning Colchest and Gosfield in the Western District, ordered to be surveyed.
Hopes to see Cockrill in Ancaster.
Concerning the appointment of George Davison as agent for purchasing provisions for the troops and garrisons in this province.
Report on ungranted lands in the province.
Thomas Talbot, respecting pardon for Thomas Nolan and Thomas Mitchell, deserters.
Recommending Mathew Wing to His Excellency's attention.
Relative to purchase of flour and peas for the troops.
Case for the opinion of the judges concerning the appointment of sheriffs in the province and the validity thereof.
Enclosed: (2) Bill of Indictment against Levy P. Cole, 14 December, 1800.
Relative to the Detroit merchants who had established themselves on the Military reserve at Amherstburg.
Schedule of Acts passed in the 4th Session of the 1st Parliament of Upper Canada.
Relative to the petition of the directors of the North West Company for land on the north side of the Sts. of St. Mary's.
Enclosing a letter from Asa Danforth who refrains from giving a full explanation on some subject not mentioned, until a later date.
General statement of public property in Upper Canada commencing with the year 1792 and ending in 1799. Expressive of the several articles of which the same did consist, with explanations.
Copy of the petition of inhabitants of Colchester and Gosfield on Lake Erie concerning their claims for additional land grants.
Transmits papers concerning premiums, offered by the Board of Agriculture for informations on the cultivation of hemp. [Enclosures not at this place.]
Under secretary of state, concerning pay lists asked for.
Warrant for the appointment of John Small as Clerk of the Council in Upper Canada.

Transmits a certified copy of an indictment against Levy P. Cole for the murder of Francis Lacquette, at Detroit, 9 October, 1800. Asks that Cole be delivered up according to 27th. Article of the Treaty enclosed. Copy of depositions against Cole taken at a special court, 17 October, 1800.
Schedule of Acts passed in 2nd Session of 2nd Parliament of Upper Canada.
Hopes to see Cockrill before leaving York.
Affidavit of Alexander Stewart concerning half-pay.
Enclosing a letter from Asa Danforth who refrains from giving a full explanation on some subject not mentioned, until a later date.
Memorial of John Rogge that he may obtain the deed for his land without payment of fees.
J. Williams. General instructions to the commissioners authorized to administer oaths.
Concerning the purchase of provisions for the King's troops and garrisons.
Copy of a report of the Executive Council of Upper Canada concerning the leasing of Crown and Clergy reserves.
Affidavit of Ensign Johnson Butler concerning his right to half-pay.
Return of public stores issued by order of Simcoe and Russell, which are to be replaced when demanded.
Directing him to select all patents for land on which the half fee has been paid at the next audit, making out a schedule thereof, and sending the patents to each district.
Mr. Justice Powell. No person to be enrolled in the Militia in future until he has produced a certificate of his having taken the oath of allegiance.

Is greatly concerned at the want of officiating clergy and at the difficulty of inducing ministers of the Established Church to settle in Canada. Temporary provision of £400 per annum has been made for 4 clergymen. Province should itself determine on some mode of provision for clergy.
Copy of the petition of John Ferguson relative to his land.
Receiver General's accounts.
Reports the loss of the oven which was burned; damage about £6.
Schedule of Acts passed by the 2nd Session of the 3rd Parliament.
Mr. Chewett's memorandum respecting the Township of Orford in the Western district.
Schedule of Acts passed in 3rd Session of the Legislature.
Settlement of the Township of Murray.
Schedule of Acts passed in 3rd Session of 2nd Parliament of Upper Canada,.
Schedule of letters and other documents delivered by President Russell to Lieut. Gov. Hunter, prepared 20 August, 1799.
Minutes of search claims allowed for parts of lots under the Commission.
Transmits a copy of an Order of His Majesty in Council dated 15 January, stating that H.M. consent to certain Acts must be obtained within 3 years or such Acts are to be considered disallowed.
Order to furnish the printer with copies of 11 Acts which received the Royal assent on the 5th inst.
Situation in Detroit.
Transmits a detail of the circumstances attendant upon the victory obtained by Field Marshall Clairfoyt over the French commanded by Pichegru and Jordain.
[Enclosed in Jas. Green to John McGill, 8 August, 1802].
Enclosed: (2) Letter 1 May, 1802.
Transmits a plan of Military reserves opposite the Isle of Bois Blanc. [Not here Enclosed] Declines to sanction the purchase of the Huron reserve.
The surveyor general to expunge from the Township of Saltfleet all locations made, for which no authority appears.
Enclosed: June 26, 1802. Letter from Asa Danforth.
Enclosed: (1) The United States vs Levy P. Cole. Copy of the depositions taken at a special court, 17 October, 1800.
The United States vs. Levy P. Cole. Depositions taken at a special court, 17 October, 1800. [Enclosed in Jas. Madison to the Lt. Governor of Upper Canada, May 5, 1801].
Schedule of letters from His Excellency General Prescott to Gov. Simcoe and Mr. President Russell.
Report that there are no lots open for location in Williamsburg and Edwardsburgh.
Report that there are no lots open for location in Matilda.

On church establishment respecting additional salaries to four clergymen from Home. Also of a clergyman accompanying Chief Justice Elmsley to Upper Canada. Money being granted from Home for the erection of churches. The Colony to make provision for the support of its own clergy. On the subject of schools and schoolmasters.
Mr. Chewett's memorandum relative to the land granting department.
Offering his excuse for long absence from the Council office on account of illness.
Benajah Mallary is a person unfit to be a magistrate.
Respecting the necessity for completing the survey of the Township of Whitchurch, Part of it is intended for the Quakers.
Request for His Excellency's instructions with respect to the following persons who have received lands in Upper Canada.
H. McDonell, deputy surveyor, furnishing a report on - Jessup's claim to certain lots in the Township of Young.
Return of Government stores issued to Capt. Thomas Seward of the Royal Artillery which are now to be replaced when required, The stores were issued by Simcoe's orders and by Russell's, (2 copies).
Wm. Jarvis sending a report of leases perfected since his last report. [Report not at this place.]
Enclosed: (1) Copy of Detroit River Garrison Orders, 25 November, 1796.
Legislative Council. Schedule of the Acts of the 1st Session of the Legislature of Upper Canada.
Relative to future grants of the waste lands of the Crown, and to the disposal of fees from the grants of land.
Printed copy of Regulations for the Navigation of British ships in time of peace. [Enclosed in Jas. Green to John McGill, 8 August, 1802].
Enclosed: (4) Copy of Regulations for the navigation of British ships in time of peace, 5 April, 1802. [Printed.]

Circular to the sheriffs and clerks of each district, directing them to transmit an annual account of the receipt of fines, amercements, and forfeitur to the inspector general, and to pay the money to the receiver general.
Fees on grants of land to Brigadier General Arnold and family.

reporting that survey money must be paid in future by all persons who are not entitled to the exemption of U.E. or M.C. if they have obtained Orders in Council for land previous to 1 July, 1796, and have not yet located the same.
Order to survey the remaining parts of Aldborough and Dunwich in District of London.
Relative to supplies of flour and peas for the troops.
Enclosed: Chas. Williamson, commanding officer at Niagara, July 4, 1792. On the establishment of the post between Williamsburg and Albany. Hopes the service will be used by the people at Niagara.
Extract of a letter. Without directions from the King's ministers he cannot sanction erection of blockhouses f o r the defence of York.
Circular to the officers of the land granting department. On the subject of land patents granted by the Crown.
Enclosed: A copy of an order made up on the petition of Peter Malot and other inhabitants of Colchester and Gosfield.
For the liberation of Lewis Le Couteulx, a native of France, but a citizen of U.S., detained in prison in Upper Canada on suspicion of having entered the country with some improper intention.
Memorandum on Kelborn's application for certain lots in Township of Scott.
Recommending Mr. Hetterick as a proper person to be entrusted with a respectable seminary.

Queen's Rangers to be quartered at York. Has ordered arms and ammunition for the Militia of Upper Canada. Regrets that the supposed murderer of the Mississagua chief was not brought to trial. Recommend that pointed regard be paid at present to the Indian nations. Has no authority to sanction the erection of blockhouses for York.
Lands there fetch but a small price. Republican cause is becoming [Illegible] some complain of the Peace.
Schedule of Acts passed in the 4th Session of the 3rd Parliament of Upper Canada.
Report of a Committee of the Council authorizing the attorney general of Upper Canada to charge the same fees for the like service as is done by the attorney genl. of Lower Canada.
Enclosed: Chas. Williamson, commanding officer at Niagara, July 4, 1792. On the establishment of the post between Williamsburg and Albany. Hopes the service will be used by the people at Niagara.
Respecting grants of land for U. E. Loyalists and their children. In certain cases grant to as much as 1200 acres to an individual. Opposes formation of settlements by associated companies.
Estimate of pay of a Corps of Foot consisting of four companies to be raised for service in Canada.
Warrant for the appointment of Robert J. D. Gray as solicitor general for Upper Canada.
On the subject of a site for his proposed settlement.
Enclosed: Draft of a bill to enforce enrolments in the militia.
Enclosed: Copy of Order in Council, 15 January, 1800 given at the Court of St. James.

Thos. Scott, answering sundry questions of John McGill, inspector general, respecting the extent of half fees that ought to be charged to Government on grants of land to privileged persons and their families.
Has received papers concerning the land business and translated them into French.
Warrant for the appointment of John Elmsley to the Legislative Council of Upper Canada.
Relative to the mode of supplying the posts in Upper Canada with provisions.
For leave to go to Quebec to settle the affairs of Rev. Dr. Delisle.
Schedule of Acts passed in the 1st Session of the 3rd Parliament of Upper Canada.
For copies of the Acts which received the Royal assent on the 5th ult. with the seal affixed
Transmits a plan for the establishment of a post between Montreal and York. [Not here enclosed.]
On the subject of a draft on Col. Mann for £133.8.3d. which has been protested. Seeks payment of the same.
Recommends Mr. Hetterick.
On the subject of salmon caught by the Indians. Reports a great scarcity of the fish this year.
tagPerson: Givins, J., agent of Indian Affairs

tagDescription: Deed of Land
Same to the same. Report on the case of Jack York, a negro, convicted of burglary.

Concerning a survey of lands granted to the Society the Propagation of the Gospel for their mission among the Indians. That they may obtain their patent deeds. Attached is the Petition of the Missionary Cottlob Senseman, dated 11 June, 1798.
Certificate of the Magistrates of New Johnstown approving of the sureties of Alexander Campbell as Registrar for the Counties of Dundas, Grenville, and Leeds.
Dr. Hicok's land.
Land for his son, Isaac.
Strength of Militia of Upper Canada.
County records. Includes Roe's reply.
Schedule of the Acts passed in the 1st Session of the 2nd Parliament of Upper Canada.
List of fees taken by Clerk of the Court of Appeals in Lower Canada.
Herman W. Ryland. Warrant for ?5000 has been issued by Deputy Pay Master General.
List of persons who have qualified for land patents and remarks thereon.
Duplicate of the above.
Reports his appointment as Judge of the Common Pleas in Upper Canada, and states that he is unable to leave until the arrival of Mr. Thorpe.
Order for 300 copies of the Proclamation for the formation of the District of Newcastle.
Chewett and Ridout. Report on the proceedings of the Commissioners in the Western District.
Also an extract of a letter April 22, 1796, relative to Acts falling under the provisions contained in the 42nd Clause of the Canada Act.
Extract of a letter with instructions about the signing of Acts passed in Upper Canada.
Regulating the mode in which searches are to be made in the future. [Copy of circular letter.]
tagPerson: officers of the land Granting Department

tagDescription: Statement of the reasons for non-compliance with the orders for engrossing deeds by the clerks in the Council office.
Printed copy of the King's Proclamation declaring the conclusion of the War. [Enclosed in Jas. Green to John McGill, 8 August, 1802.]
Enclosed: (3) Copy of the King's Proclamation declaring conclusion of the war, Whitehall, 26 April, 1802. [Printed]
Schedule of claims in the Council office.
H. Allcock, giving his opinion on the validity of the appointment of sheriffs. Attached is a copy of the case for the opinion of the judges of July 10.
Mr. Strachan will accept Mr. Rudd's situation at Cornwall as one of the established clergy of the Province.
Schedule of leases for Crown and clergy reserves with the date on which the rent commences.
Order to furnish a copy of the last Assessment Bill.
Asking if there is any difficulty in Mr. Askin's claim, in the commissioner report for 1799.
Copy of a Report of the Executive Council relative to fees on grants of land.
Concerning the payment of salary due to Col. Sinclair.
Opinion of Chief Justice Elmsley on the questions proposed to the Judges by Hunter respecting the validity of the appointment of sheriffs. [See July 10 above].
Petition for privilege of establishing iron works at or near the waters on River Niagara. Seeks a grant of or lease for 999 years of a certain plot of land for this purpose.
Certificate that Western Allan's name is on the additional United Empire Roll, Eastern District.
Enclosed: 6 October, 1800. Order to pay Douglas the above sum of money.
[Enclosed in Douglas to Robert Pilkington, June 7, 1801].
Report on the case of the King vs. Wm. Newberry, indicted for a highway robbery.
Petition of Barney Haines and others concerning a dispute between them and the estate of Mr. Small, regarding encroachments on the small estate.
General Hunter's special authority for admitting the children of Mary Brant to the U.E. list.
Duplicate of the previous document.
Enclosed: A transcript of the evidence of Jane Lambert on the same.
Blank form for grants of land.
agent for purchases for Upper Canada. Approbation of McGill's activities in purchasing flour and peas for the troops.
Relative to orders issued for a frigate to convoy the trade to England.

Transmits a paper to vindicate himself from a charge of intrusion upon the Executive Government. Asks His Excellency to support his petition for compensation of his services. [Paper not at this place].
Transmits memorial and estimate from Jarvis, [Enclosures not at this place.]
Transmits the presentment of the Grand Jury, Western District, relative to the Huron reserve as a notorious nuisance, and a refuge for rogues and vagabonds. Powell's comments on the reserve.
Wm. Smith's application for a deed.
Respecting a grant of land to the members of the Executive Council in consideration of the loss they must have sustained in their private fortunes by the removal of the seat of Government.
